metadata.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Environmental Science
metadata.subtitle: in America
metadata.description: The Best Colleges for Environmental Science ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top colleges for earth sciences, geology, forestry, meteorology, and climatology.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges ranking is based on rigorous analysis of academic, admissions, financial, and student life data from the U.S. Department of Education along with millions of reviews from students and alumni. The ranking compares more than 1,000 top colleges and universities in the U.S.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Engineering
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Engineering ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top engineering schools in the U.S.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Biology
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Biology ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top degree programs for biology majors including ecology, marine biology, microbiology, biotechnology, botany, and pre-medicine programs.

related.title: 2018 Best Colleges for Agricultural Sciences
related.subtitle: in America
related.description: The Best Colleges for Agricultural Sciences ranking is based on key statistics and student reviews using data from the U.S. Department of Education. The ranking compares the top agricultural science degree programs including horticulture, aquaculture, agronomy, crop science, and turf management.

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Hollins is a wonderful environment to live and learn in! There is a real sense of community; the history and quirkiness of the school only add to the charm. While the faculty and staff are incredibly caring and attentive. There are also a ton of opportunities on and off campus. Roanoke is a great location in the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains which provides endless hiking trails and outdoor areas to explore, and downtown is just a quick drive from campus as well, there really is something for everyone.  The number of clubs, organizations, and activities on campus is incredible considering the schools size.  Academically the student to teacher ratio is awesome, I love knowing all my Professors personally and having them know me. Professors really seem to care about your thoughts and want you to be involved in class. They will really go out of their way in order to insure you have the best experience possible.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Life at the U of A is a dream! #1, Ben Rector went here and throws us free concerts! But on the realâ€” campus is absolutely beautiful, especially to a girl from flat Texas like me! Fayetteville is utterly charming, and has something for everyone. With thousands of international students and its central location, the diversity is special and so treasured on this campus. I am never worried about making friends of different backgrounds, or finding my niche with those who share my cultural background because it happens so naturally. There are also plenty of religious groups to get plugged into on and around campus. My only complaint is the Hill, but it is worth it to live in Pomfret Hall with bigger bathrooms, a nice common area, and the dining hall which comes in handy on days of inclement weather. I truly love being a Razorback, and am so grateful to call Northwest Arkansas my second home.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Western Washington University has a great community established in the university as well as surrounding the university. The people are friendly and caring with some diversity in the student body through students of color and out of state students. The staff at the university ranging from Professors, Teaching Assistants, Custodial Workers, and more are wonderful and very respectful to the university and those who are at the university. Western gives an amazing experience to those who value their education and have fun while doing so!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Alum
featuredReview.body: Best decision of my life. The student population is not too big and not too small, with hundreds of student organizations or volunteer groups to join. The professors are top notch and genuinely care about your education and future career goals. In addition, the career center is huge and efficient, offering advising on everything from internships and graduate/law school searches to interviewing for jobs at any point in your career. Once an Eagle, always an Eagle!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: I transferred into TCU at the beginning of the 2017 fall semester from a local community college.  They were so incredibly welcoming, and had events and tours specifically for transfer students. There were so many of us, I made a ton of friends! I love this campus, they're constantly doing work on it, making the students' and faculty's lives at school that much more enjoyable. The grass is always green, they change the flowers for the season, there are a ton of resources everywhere you look and all of my professors know me by name because there aren't that many students per class. All around, it's my dream University.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: The University of Tennessee is a great school.  This school heavily emphasizes research, so if you happen to get professors who are there for research and teach because they have to then you may have a lacking experience.  However, I have had wonderful professors who really care about your education.  This school offered many experiences and organizations to be involved in, and I am sure I would have enjoyed college much more if I lived on campus and got involved.  Overall the campus was amazing and my education was as well. You get out of it what you put into it!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: University of Missouri- Columbia is a school that allows such a variety of studies that almost anyone can find a major they will enjoy pursuing. Personally, it was one of only a few schools in Missouri with my emphasis area of Nuclear Medicine Technologist which is a major reason I choose to attend this school. This decision was a great one because Mizzou has helped me grow personally, emotionally, religiously, and in so many other ways. The amount of clubs and organizations that are on campus allows everyone to be involved in something they are passionate about!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Nice quiet campus out of the way, good solid classes, workable work load but challenging, very hands on, big on critical thinking. Dorms for freshmen are NICE. The older grades get kinda cruddy dorms though. Diversity is excellent. Agriculture department is very strong. Big study abroad department. The local area is pretty sparse, but there is a lot to work with on campus. Winters are cold. Would like warmer winters. Nothing worth complaining about, 5/5. If you go there for an Ag or Business degree, you will be will get a good education.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
Ohio University is more than just the four years you are here. It's about the lasting memories you make and knowledge you gain. While it is a bit taunting to go out and enjoy the social and bar scenes around campus, OU is all about time management. It's very hard to get caught up in the fun of things and forget about academics. But it is most certainly not impossible. If students take their time here, and use the networking and resources that are available it is absolutely amazing the places you can go. The oppritunities are so beyond contrary belief.  

College has been the best time of my life, Ohio University has already opened so many doors for so many and it just keeps growing and getting better.   Come check it out!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I adore the sense of family here! Despite the size of the student population, Auburn University feels like home! I would like to see more information about on campus student job opportunities more frequently announced. Other than that, there is not much to complain about. I have had some really good teachers as well as some not so good teachers, but overall my experiences has been great. The courses are time consuming and require one to put in effort, however, that is to be expected.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: In the heart of Bozeman, Montana,  MSU offers a great college experience! Surrounded by mountains, the extracurriculars are endless with skiing, camping, hiking, fishing and biking. Campus is gorgeous through every season, with a mix of old and new buildings, each with their own character. Professors listen and show true passion towards their subjects.  Dorm life was a great experience, and even outside of the dorms there are awesome housing opportunities through town. Overall has been amazing and I have met lifelong friends and gained a lifetime of knowledge through Montana State University.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: I am an out of state student attending USC for the first year of pursuing a 4 year degree. In the beginning I was uncomfortable with my transition and unable to feel at home. Through clubs and sports teams I was able to develop new friendships and life skills that made me feel more at home. There are so many opportunities presented to students at USC that all should take advantage of. One of the most important things that is clearly valued here, is academics. My professors so far have been some of the most passionate people I have met. A favorite course I have taken here has been environmental ethics. I took this course as a philosophy requirement and it inspired me to change my major to environmental studies. The professor and the course material inspired me to make a decision that I will not soon regret. I am more than happy to say that I am a student at USC. If someone decides to attend school here, I bet they will say the same thing. Go Gamecocks!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: Stony Brook does a fantastic job at getting the students involved in campus life, with multiple activities and events every week. They also excel in academics, it is a great research school! Stony Brook is currently working on making its weakest department better, the food. However, The food options have become non-diverse and unhealthy since the most recent food company, SODEXO, has taken over. Stony Brook has since put in efforts to replace the company in order to fix these problems.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: As a current sophomore at Saint Louis University, I want to preface by saying that I could not see myself at any other university. SLU is an extremely open college where you will meet people from diverse backgrounds who have different experiences. Of course, people will always complain and say that the "rich white people" surround SLU. However, if you actually try and engage in the SLU community you will find more than just that. SLU has given me life long friends and an education that I am proud of. So far my classes have gone well and are usually well taught. If there are any complaints, there are always surveys at the end of the semester that go straight to the department heads for review. Finding the right college for you is difficult. I was lucky enough to fall in love with SLU as soon as I visited. I definitely suggest visiting and doing an overnight to see if SLU is right for you. Roll Bills!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: Although at first glance I was not completely sure SU would be the school for me, after simply days there I knew that I was home. The classes are small, and the teachers truly care about the individual educations of their students. I was so encouraged in my desire to pursue not only a double major, but a minor as well. Southwestern truly encourages you to reach for your dreams. And they have so many resources available for you to actually achieve those dreams. I have found lifelong mentors and friends at Southwestern, and I highly recommend it to all!

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The extra opportunities at DU are fantastic! Not to mention the personable size, phenomenally balanced and experienced professors, and stellar location, the Honors Program and Pioneer Leadership Program add extra communities and "niches," if you will, in the school. I'm a freshman this year, and my expectations were exceeded because of these great programs! I'm so excited for what's to come in these next four years. DU has something for everyone, and responds SO well to self activism.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body: During my experience at Earlham College so far, it has been fantastic. I have met so many great people here in just one year. Everyone on campus is so nice and easygoing. The classes and professors are also wonderful. There is just a variety of majors and classes to take. Not just academics but there are curricular activities on campus as well. There are so many different clubs and sports that you can join. There is so much that one can do on and off of campus throughout the school year. I highly recommend applying for Earlham College or just coming to visit our campus sometime, you will truly love it!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body:
Texas Tech University is a fantastic place to go to school. The school is vibrant, the students are largely enthusiastic, both the locals and more experienced students alike are welcoming, and most importantly, it isn't the most expensive option. With a police response time beneath a minute thanks to their blue light system set up all around campus, the massive number of resources available to the average student (including a free use 3D printer in the library!), and food that's relatively cheap with a massive student discount available, living and schooling at Texas Tech is a phenomenal experience that I would recommend to anyone looking to go to school in Texas.

So long as you don't mind the 8 hour trip to get to anywhere noteworthy, that is!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: The University of Idaho is great place to get an education. I have gone to both Washington State University and the University of Idaho, and I believe the University of Idaho gives students a very high chance to succeed. I love the University of Idaho because to the faculty and staff, you are not just a number like you are at larger schools such as WSU. These people here actually care about you and take the time to get to personally know you and understand you and try and get the most out of you. Another thing is, professors at UI do all they can to help you find internships and jobs because they actually care and want everyone to succeed. I would highly recommend the University of Idaho. Go Vandals!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: DePaul University is academically stimulating, socially enriching, and caters to support individuals of any background. The academics are enlightening and incorporates a healthy balance of neurological stimulation without being too challenging. Diversity is present, however, can be improved (as anywhere else). The Athletic facilities are impressive! The Professors are individually unique and most often offer guidance, whether academically or on a more personal level. DePaul offers a wide range of student related resources and services that can benefit one's overall experience. DePaul is a platform, what you do with it is up to you!

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Niche User
featuredReview.body: I love Alabama's active student life, an array of majors, school spirit, and greek life options! I feel safe on campus, have helpful and knowledgeable professors. Game day at the University of Alabama is unlike any other school. Pom poms shake throughout Bryant Denny Stadium and each spectator is completely invested in Alabama's sports teams. Moving 18 hours away from home was extremely nerve-racking but Alabama could not feel more like home. The amount of scholarship offered to out-of-state students is amazing and helps combat the high cost.

grades.description: Based on millions of statistics and student reviews.
grades.label: Overall Niche Grade

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Sophomore
featuredReview.body:
UCI is a nice place in the sense that it's generally safe and easy to get around. Professors vary from each other; since the university is a research university (and they take pride over that), your professors will vary from individual to individual. It's not surprising if your professor is super smart but horrible in teaching. You really have to fight for yourself here in studying, but that's not saying there aren't good Professors at all - there are! Emphasis on Professors because sometimes that's just what'll make or break your happiness for that quarter or so.

That being said, it's also not surprising to question your tuition here if it's worth it or not. UCI is a great place for connections, and if you learn well here and you connect well, then the money you put in here is pretty worth.

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Junior
featuredReview.body: I really like Binghamton but there is room for improvement. As a psychology major it is hard to get into classes you need as they close out, even if you came in with a ton of AP credits. Also, so many classes are big so its harder to focus and do well in them. The campus is hilly. Academics are great, iâ€™ve only had one bad teacher. Advising sucks I had to figure everything out on my own. Mountainview dorms were awfull, invisible RA, no community events, unfriendly people etc. Now I live in Newing and I love it and itâ€™s so much better! Many Long Island students, intentational students (mostly from Asia) and Jewish students. You have to find your people at this school but once you do your experience can be great. Also, we donâ€™t have certain majors like education (also communications, and others people complain about) which really sucks but they try to sell you on their grad program. The food is hit or miss, definitely go to the Kosher station since they have the best food.

badge.display: Best Colleges for Environmental Science in America

featuredReview.author: Freshman
featuredReview.body: The college is an excellent place, I love every second on this campus, yes sometimes the work load can be a lot but there is very good tutoring on campus. Also the regiment program is definitely something I recommend for all who are looking into the school. It keeps you in line where as other schools you don't have that type of guidance where someone is always helping you. Another thing I like is that the regiment is very student based so they understand the struggles of the regiment program as well as the work load of the school. The school has amazing job placement coming out of this school; coming from someone who has family history from the school I can definitely back up my statement.

featuredReview.author: Senior
featuredReview.body: As a music major, Goshen College has phenomenal facilities! The concert hall is comparable to Carnegie Hall, and international names come through regularly to perform. Because the college is small, class sizes are often around 20 students, and professors are very accessible.
